subject: Standard Operating Procedure for one time settlement through the scheme “Vivad se Vishwas II (Contractual Disputes)”- reg.
text: ARd 75l4 <THRf giferasrot (4e35 4Rae7 &r TTHri 4AR4, 4RT TAR) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) Tata T il-5 gd 6, 44er-10, 214T, 7$ @ochf 110 075 0 6-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 3H/Phone 91-11-25074100 / 25074200 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/ Dispute Resolution/ 2023 Policy Circular No.2.1.60/ 2023 dated 04th July, 2023 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. NHAI/ Vivad/se/ Vishwas-Il/2023 (Comp. No. 210288)} Sub: Standard Operating Procedure for one time settlement through the scheme Vivad se Vishwas Il (Contractual Disputes) " reg: Ministry of Finance, Dept. of   Expenditure vide their OM No. F.1/7/2022-PPD dated 29.05.2023 (Annexure I) has decided to implement a one time settlement scheme called "Vivad se Vishwas II (Contractual Disputes)' to effectively settle pending  disputes. Ministry  of Road, Transport & Highways vide their letter No. NH-24028/09/2022-H (E- 1 94788) dated 06.06.2023 has forwarded the OM to NHAI for necessary compliance- The date of commencement of the scheme shall be 15.07.2023 and claims can be submitted upto 31.10.2023. For smooth implementation of the scheme, the following Standard Operating Procedure (SoP) is to be followed: 1. Government e-Market Place  (GeM) will    provide a dedicated link on their  portal for implementation of the scheme_ Contractors are to register themselves on the portal through their authorized personnel. General Manager (Legal) , NHAI shall advise National Highway Builders Federation (NHBF) to ask its members to register on GeM portal: ji. The registered Contractors shall submit the eligible disputes on the GeM portal. iii. GeM shall notify NHAI of the Contractor s submission. GM (Legal) will be the nodal officer for receiving the intimation from the portal and forward the same to the concerned GM(Tech: ) . iv. Disputes where the award by Court/ Arbitral Tribunal (AT) is oly for monetary value will be   eligible for settlement under this scheme_ In case the award   stipulates specific performance of contract (either fully or partially); such awards will not be eligible for settlement through this scheme- Where the claimed amount by the Contractor is upto Rs. 500 Crores: a. Technical Division shall evaluate the settlement amount within one week and the same shall be forwarded to GM (Fin:) for concurrence b GM (Fin:) shall examine the evaluation by Technical Division, including interest & taxes and forward the same to concerned Member through Member (Fin.) within 3 days. C. The settlement amount shall be approved by Member concerned_ d_ In case there is any issue in interpretation of AT award, Technical Division shall promptly consult Advocate of NHAI who defended NHAI before AT/ Court: GM (Legal) shall assist Technical Division in getting prompt response from such advocate. GM(Legal) shall collect, consolidate & circulate every fortnight views of NHAI on such interpretation issues with the approval of CGM(Legal) for the benefit of all Tech Divisions Contd_2I - Ka T U 8 NHAL
